entries.def: To call (+acc sbd./sth.) (+abs sbd./sth.). In PF, this verb used to take a double accusative, but this usage disappeared early on in UF, with the second accusative naturally being replaced by the absolutive, likely to avoid ambiguity that was starting to manifest as a result of UF’s increasingly free word order. Snet’h v.2 jdap rác’hsaý’adâ ‘I call you a liar’; even in the writings of Snet’h, the double accusative is no longer attested.
To approach, come near, walk up to (+<uf-s>all</uf-s> sbd./sth.).
The day after tomorrow. The prefix aḅr can be prepended as often as necessary, e.g. aḅraḅraḅrdvê would be ‘in four days’.

senses.def: To cut down, fell, knock down, shoot down.

entries.def: To push, press, shove, drive (+<uf-s>ill</uf-s> into).

senses.def: To cut or cleave with an axe.
+acc def of árb intr. (other than literal) To get to the point, cut to the chase.

+acc def of árb and acc To bring to light, reveal. Originally, this idiom did not take a double acc, but was instead formed with the acc of ‘tree’ and the ill of the object, meaning something along the lines of ‘to bring down the tree(s) on sth’—the image here being that of cutting down trees in a wood until only a clearing remains or is ‘brought to light’.
aḍrá faúr intr. To take shape, take form.
+<uf-s>gen</uf-s> To say goodbye to sbd., bid sbd. farewell.
+<uf-s>part</uf-s> To be in love with, have a crush on.

examples: Snet’h iv.17 jad’hóré ávvaúríhe ‘I yearned to remember’ (compare jad’hóré devvaúríhe ‘I loved to remember’).

entries.def: Sky. Often plural, especially in a religious sense..
To hate, abhor, detest, loathe, despise (+<uf-s>acc</uf-s> sbd./sth.).
To attack, assail, beset, bully (+<uf-s>acc</uf-s> sbd.).
Not, no. Commonly ’sý’ýâ after vowels and verbs. This particle is used only in the indicative; see also sá, t’hé.
Not-. Used to negate nouns, adjectives, and adverbs; see §~}.

senses.def: +<uf-s>abl</uf-s> To gain purchase on or hei­ght or distance from.

entries.forms: pres ant and pret y, obsolete pret ab’hẹ, fut aúrẹ́, subj ès

entries.def: Druid. Only the nórávíc’h is inflected; infixing of adj. is attested. Snet’h, iii.2: derúb’h phá ráinórávíc’h ‘to find the great druid’, with infixed rá.
Thought, reflection, meditation, faculty of thinking.
(+ <uf-s>aci</uf-s>) To be interested in, willing to, ready to, prepared for.
Part, portion, piece, faction of a whole.
+subj Because. Often used to explain motivation rather than cause, as in e.g. ‘We did that because…’.

entries.forms: <uf-s>fut</uf-s> baúré, <uf-s>subj</uf-s> véy’ýrs; <uf-s>comp</uf-s> lẹvéy’ýr, y’ŷvéy’ýr, rêvéy’ýr; <uf-s>sup</uf-s> révéy’ýr, râdvâv­éy’­ýr
<uf-s>fut</uf-s> rêdẹ́, <uf-s>subj</uf-s> ḅẹt’hes; <uf-s>comp</uf-s> lẹrêd, y’ŷrêd, rêrêd; <uf-s>sup</uf-s> rérêd, râdvârêd

entries.def: The day before yesterday. The prefix b’hâ can be prepended as often as necessary, e.g. b’hâb’hâb’hây’ér would be ‘four days ago’.
+subj So that, so as to, to, in order to. Commonly enclitic ’b’h after vowels.

entries.etym: from <uf-pf>vérité</uf-pf>; the /i/ disappeared during Early Middle UF

senses.def: +<uf-s>spress</uf-s> To watch over, guard, keep an eye on.

entries.etym: back-formation from *<uf-w>b’heý’os</uf-w>, reanalysed as a subjunctive; from <uf-pf>véloce</uf-pf>

entries.def: +<uf-s>instr</uf-s> To be incapable of being af­fec­ted by, invulnerable to.
Male given name, equivalent to English ‘Kyle’ or ‘Charles’. Often declined like a regular noun, e.g. nom Lác̣ár.

senses.def: +<uf-s>part</uf-s> To stumble, do a bad job at.

To be dear, important (+dat to sbd.). Possession of a noun qualified with this adjective verb is generally construed with the dative rather than the genitive, e.g. asvẹ áví cérâ or áví cérâvé ‘my dear friend’, rather than *vaú áví cérâ.

examples: <uf-w>áví lẹcérvé</uf-w> ‘he is a (dear) friend of mine’.

entries.def: To end for good, put to a permanent end.

senses.def: c’haú-L} ‘religious prefix’, prepended in derivation to nouns that have a religous connotation; this is historically a back-formation from c’haúfrér and c’haúhýr which happen to both start with this ‘prefix’.

entries.def: To be complacent; to be accepting in the presence of +<uf-s>gen</uf-s> sbd./sth. perceived as negative.
Brother (religious). Masc. or pl. only, see also c’haúhýr.
Some, a few, a couple of.
Is it? Also substituted for other forms of ‘to be’ in questions, particularly for the plural neuter; stressed on the first syllable.

senses.def: +gen usually indef To sell, offer, have in stock.
âc’hóvâ def. Beginning, start. Lit. ‘that which is being begun’.

entries.def: To shrink, reduce in size, narrow.
male or female given name, equivalent to English ‘Dominic’.
+<uf-s>subj</uf-s> Once, when once, as soon as.
To become, turn into (+transl sth./sbd.). The subject is in the abs case.

senses.def: +<uf-s>acc</uf-s> To rend asunder, tear to pieces.
Surface of a body of water.

entries.def: Emphatic particle; only used in the preterite.

Emphatic particle, used as an intensifier, often postpositive after the verb, but not so much intensifying the verb directly as it does the entire clause. Snet’h, ii.34: lá-árb srýlé dèl ‘so it was that the tree was burning’ or ‘the tree was burning fiercely’, or ‘indeed, the tree was burning’.
+<uf-s>acc</uf-s> To direct, run, oversee, operate (a business or establishment).

+ dat & acc/part To endow, bestow, give. The acc is used when talking about concrete, measurable, and finite objects or sums; the partitive to talk about abstract concepts or parts of objects; the dat is the person being endowed with.
At least. As in e.g. ‘At least, I think that …’.
+<uf-s>opt</uf-s> In such a way that, such that, so much so.
Very, right, really. Postpositive intensifier placed after adjectives, particularly in the comparative or superlative degrees..

senses.def: To do, make, build, construct, erect.

entries.def: To make a big fuss a­bout something.

entries.etym: back-formation from *<uf-w>fic’hs</uf-w>, reinterpreted as a subjunctive stem; from <uf-pf>fixer</uf-pf>

entries.def: To deliver, provide (+<uf-s>dat</uf-s> sbd.) (+ <uf-s>acc</uf-s> with sth.).
male or female given name, equivalent to English ‘John’ or ‘Joan’.

senses.def: refl To wash oneself, take a bath, have a shower.

entries.def: Evasive, unclear, or overly formal speech.
(contraction) But, when. Stressed on the first syllable.
Chiefly in questions or imperative. To let, allow, permit.
To be evident, obvious, frank, clear.
To litigate, be at law with (+<uf-s>dat</uf-s> sbd.).
Base of the spatial correlatives. In senses 2–5, case affixes are attached before ḷý, e.g. sense 2 all sẹb’héḷý ‘hither’.

senses.def: ḷýhes indef [from c’hes] Where, whither, when­ce, &c. Interrogative (locative cases only).

entries.etym: from <uf-pf>leur</uf-pf>; the ‘ḍ’ was added in analogy with <uf-w>naúḍ</uf-w> and <uf-w>b’hauḍ</uf-w>

entries.def: neg. only No longer, not any more. The meaning of this and lẹ swapped at some point for unknown reasons.
To narrate, recount <uf-s>+part sth.</uf-s>, tell (<uf-s>+dat</uf-s> sbd.) a story.
To be born. <uf-s>This is a deponent verb whose subject takes the <uf-s>acc</uf-s> and which only takes passive affixes.</uf-s>.
To deny, ref­use, reject, rebut (+<uf-s>acc</uf-s> sbd./sth.).

senses.def: <uf-s>def iness + gen</uf-s> On the level of.

entries.etym: unknown; presumably the name of some celebrity or local deity

senses.def: indecl. def sg always nom or voc Ráb’h. Main god of the ULTRAFRENCH pantheon; usually male. Old-fashioned also often all-caps RÁB’H..
examples: <uf-s>Snet’h</uf-s>, <uf-s>i.17</uf-s>: <uf-w>au lebálá daú RÁB’H</uf-w> ‘and thus spake Ráb’h’.

senses.def: Ráb’h sénýr def sg Lord Ráb’h. Used for 1 in all other cases; as with all names, only sénýr is inflected. Old-fashioned often RÁB’H Sénýr.
examples: <uf-s>Snet’h</uf-s>, <uf-s>8.1</uf-s>: <uf-w>au labraúc RÁB’H naút B’héhénýr</uf-w> ‘and they came to our Lord Ráb’h’.

senses.def: (rarely) The main god of another culture. Only attested figuratively. Not capitalised in this sense, and declined like a regular word..
examples: <uf-s>Snet’h</uf-s>, <uf-s>ii.3</uf-s>: <uf-w>ledéraújá’z derévôt’he láráb’h</uf-w> ‘their god demanded they return’.

entries.def: To lie, tell tall tales, overexaggerate.
+acc or part To grab. The part usually implies that only a part or some of a larger whole is grabbed, e.g. a handful of sand).
To meet, encounter, come face to face (+<uf-s>all</uf-s> with sbd.).
Sword, blade áráhut’h’t ilý ly b’haúr ‘the pen is mightier than the sword’ (originally a fossilised, obsolete ACI: á­hut’h­rá éḍ ilý lẹb’haúr).

senses.def: To come to light, become known, transpire.
pres ant For it to be clear, apparent, evident that …Lit. ‘it has come to light that …’.

entries.def: Kid. This is grammatically a vocative—not that one could tell since it looks identical to the absolutive.
To raise, lift up (+<uf-s>acc</uf-s> sth.) (+<uf-s>ela</uf-s> from sth.).

senses.def: Raúl (definite only) Short for T’hebhaú Raúl. nom sg irreg. Raúl; all other forms are regular.
Grammar, the grammatical rules of a language.
A textbook describing the grammar of a language.
To travel, go on a journey.
<uf-w>ráy’ê y’aúhý</uf-w> + <uf-s>aci</uf-s> There is no way, that …}.
<uf-s>instr pl</uf-s> <uf-w>b’hehráy’ê</uf-w> How, by what means, in this way.

entries.def: In vain, for nothing.Usually preceded directly by the verb it applies to.
To be composed of three parts or people; triune.

senses.def: To prevent, stop (+<uf-s>acc</uf-s> sth. from happening).

entries.def: +s{opt} To fear, lest …Construed with the negated optative.

senses.def: +<uf-s>aci</uf-s> To take upon onself to do sth.
+<uf-s>pci</uf-s> To take upon oneself to start doing sth.

entries.def: To reduce (+acc or pass. sbd./sth.) (+all to sth.).

senses.def: An article of clothing, garment, piece of clothing.

entries.def: To handle, take care of, deal with.

senses.def: +<uf-s>part</uf-s> To pull on sth. without actually moving it; to try to pull sth.

entries.def: Alas, woe, oh. Exclamation of distress, surprise, sadness, or regret.
entries.forms: after words that end with ‘r’, this is spelt -vá instead

entries.def: Not, no. Always enclitic s’ before vowels. This particle is used only in the subjunctive; see also asý’ýâ, t’hé.
To know (+part/acc sth. case depends on the depth of the speaker’s understanding).
It is due to (+<uf-s>gen</uf-s> sth. / +<uf-s>aci</uf-s> the fact that...).
+def noun This, these. Precedes and is attached to nouns.
To help, succour, give aid (+<uf-s>dat</uf-s> to sb.) (+<uf-s>aci</uf-s>/<uf-s>acc</uf-s> with sth.).
To be similar, alike (+<uf-s>gen</uf-s> to sth.).
Ground, floor, earth, soil.The plural may be used to indicate a large quantity of soil.

senses.def: +<uf-s>part</uf-s> To help support, hold up part of.

entries.def: +<uf-s>part, pci</uf-s> To care about, worry about.
The one, that one, this one.
intr. or +gen To be superior to, better than, higher than.

senses.def: To supplement (acc sth.) (+instr with sth.). If no instr is present, the subject is implied to be the supplement.

entries.def: +def noun That, those. Precedes and is attached to nouns; often sý’ before vowels, with one apostrophe, not two.
Not, no. Always t’h’N before vowels, but does not nasalise if the ‘é’ is still present. This particle is used only in the optative; see also asý’ýâ, sá.
The ULTRAFR­ENCH language. Only T’hebhaú is declined as though the entire phrase were one word. In informal speech and writing, this is typically shortened to Raúl.

senses.def: +inf/aci To be able to, can. Never construed with an inf if it in and of itself is the infinitive of an aci or pci, in which case the variant with the part (2) is used instead.
opt cond i + aci To be possible; may. Dynamic or epistemic, never deontic; this and sense 4 are essentially a more emphatic optative.
opt cond ii + aci Might. Dynamic or epistemic, never deontic.

entries.def: To depend on predictions of the future. Of disputed origin; first attested in the works of the Early UF comedian J. A. B. Snet’h.
entries.etym: <uf-pf>vendre la peau de ours avant de avoir tué</uf-pf>

senses.def: +part or pass To miss. The object and subject of this verb are swapped compared to English ‘to miss’, e.g. b’hývvâhé (2pl.act + 1sg.pass) ‘I miss you (pl)’, lit. roughly ‘you (pl) are wanting to me’).
pass +aci Must, have to, be obliged to. The subject is always in the passive in this sense only.
cond i + aci Even if; e.g. aúrdyssa dẹće ‘even if he should fail’.

entries.forms: <uf-s>fut</uf-s> bíré, <uf-s>subj</uf-s> bíres; <uf-s>comp</uf-s> lẹbír, y’ŷbír, rêbír; <uf-s>sup</uf-s> réb’hír, râdvâbír

senses.def: <uf-w>dyvérs fér</uf-w> To thank (+<uf-s>dat</uf-s> sbd.) (+<uf-s>gen</uf-s> for sth.).

entries.def: There is no, there are no, there is none.
Nothing. Like most negative polarity items, this induces negation of the verb.
Considering that, since, because. Unlike c’haúr, this does not take the subjunctive; it is used to indicate the (potential) cause of something.
